summary: This document is an email chain from August 2019 regarding an inmate's complaint about medical treatment at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. The inmate expresses frustration with medication side effects and accuses medical staff of negligence, specifically referencing Jeffrey Epstein's death and hoping the staff involved are fired.

persons.name: Associate Warden MCC New York
persons.context: Recipient of an email chain regarding an inmate's complaint about medical treatment; their office is listed.

persons.name: Dr.
persons.context: Mentioned by the inmate as the doctor prescribing medication that causes side effects; the inmate questions how treatment decisions are made without direct consultation.

events.title: Inmate Medication Complaint
events.description: An inmate sends a complaint about medication side effects (migraines, metallic taste) and accuses medical staff of negligence, referencing Epstein.

events.title: Email Forward Regarding Inmate Complaint
events.description: An email is forwarded to the Associate Warden regarding the inmate's complaint and reference to Epstein's neglect.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: An inmate at MCC New York in August 2019 complained about medication side effects and accused medical staff of negligence.
The inmate explicitly referenced Jeffrey Epstein's death, stating 'I'm praying you're involved with epsteins neglect and you get fired.'
The complaint was escalated via email to the Associate Warden of MCC New York.
The document shows inmate frustration with the medical treatment process and lack of direct consultation with prescribing doctors.
